title: Find the Null
question_text: Which of the following is a null hypothesis for a chi-square test of homogeneity?

choices.text:
H
0
: Two categorical variables in a population are associated.

H
0
: There is no difference in distributions of a categorical variable across populations.

H
0
: The proportions given for a set of categorical data are what they are.

H
0
: There is a difference in distributions of a categorical variable across populations.

H
0
: There is no association between two categorical variables in a given population
